required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Surveillance Registry (LSR) of ACUITY Spiral
clinical_study.official_title: Condition of Approval Study: Longitudinal Surveillance Registry of the ACUITY Spiral Lead

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of the LSR of ACUITY Spiral is to evaluate and report on the long-term performance of the ACUITY Spiral Left Ventricular Lead.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Early termination was granted by FDA based on study results meeting the post approval requirements.

primary_outcome.measure: Chronic Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication Free Rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Date of enrollment to study completion (Date of 5 year follow-up, withdrawal or death).

arm_group.description: Patients successfully implanted with the ACUITY Spiral Lead

intervention.description: The implant of the ACUITY Spiral Lead

study_pop.textblock: The population will be a broad base representative of those recieving the ACUITY Spiral lead.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has been or will be implanted with the ACUITY Spiral Lead within 29 days
- Plans to remain in the long-term care of his/her enrolling physician
- Is willing and capable (or appropriate legal representative) of authorizing access to and use of health information as required by an institution's institutional review board (IRB)
- Is willing and capable (or appropriate legal representative) of providing authorization for participation in the registry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Is unable or unwilling to comply with the protocol requirements

facility.name: Heart and Vascular Institute of Florida
Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania

group.title: Implants
group.description: Patients successfully implanted or underwent an attempted implant with the ACUITY Spiral Lead ACUITY Spiral Left Ventricular Lead: The implant of the ACUITY Spiral Lead

baseline.population: Baseline data includes data on the patients that received an implant or underwent an attempted implant. This does not include intent patients who were consented but did not participate in the trial and did not undergo anesthesia.

outcome.title: Chronic Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication Free Rate
outcome.time_frame: Date of enrollment to study completion (Date of 5 year follow-up, withdrawal or death).

group.title: Implants
group.description: Patients successfully implanted or underwent an attempted implant with the ACUITY Spiral Lead ACUITY Spiral Left Ventricular Lead: The implant of the ACUITY Spiral Lead

measure.title: Chronic Left Ventricular Lead-related Complication Free Rate

measurement_list.measurement: Interval is only calculated for the lower end. The method is defined as the lower one-sided 95% confidence interval compared to the confidence boundary of 92.5%.

analysis.groups_desc: The endpoint data reflected here is a modified primary endpoint analysis requested by the Food and Drug Administration early in the registry to include data that is related to the left ventricular lead function in a chronic setting.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Primary endpoint was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method. In addition, Greenwood's formula was used to calculate the lower one-sided 95% confidence bound.
analysis.estimate_desc: The lower one-sided 95% confidence bound was pre-specified to be greater than 92.5%.

analysis.groups_desc: The non-modified primary endpoint analysis initially included confirmed chronic LV lead related complications that result in permanent loss of therapy, invasive intervention, injury or death, and are deemed attributable to a structural lead failure by an independent Clinical Events Committee (CEC). These results are represented here.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Primary endpoint was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method. In addition, Greenwood's formula was used to calculate the lower one-sided 95% confidence bound.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from the time of enrollment into the trial through completion of the registry at 5 years, date of withdrawal or death.
reported_events.desc: Adverse event reporting for the LSR of ACUITY Spiral trial included all pulse generator, or lead (Left Ventricular, Right Ventricular or atrial leads are all included) related events occurring at or after implant. Reportable events are defined as inappropriate performance of the pulse generator or leads that result in an undesirable or unanticipated procedure or clinical occurrence.

group.title: Implants
group.description: Patients successfully implanted or underwent an attempted implant with the ACUITY Spiral Lead ACUITY Spiral Left Ventricular Lead: The implant of the ACUITY Spiral Lead

event.sub_title: Lead Revision for no heart failure improvement, Left Ventricular
Inability to provide therapy, pulse generator

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Early termination was granted based on study results. The study was one-armed observational. The expected performance / safety of left ventricular leads has been established; permitting comparison to a pre-defined performance standard.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Director of Clinical Trial Management - cRM franchise
